maml:description.maml:para: Connects to British Gas Hive API and retrieves An Access Token

The Connect-Hive function is used to connect to the Hive 6.1 API, Hive API returns a unique token to represent the user's credentials for subsequent calls. Acquire a token before running other PowerHive cmdlets.

maml:Description.maml:para: Hive User name
Hive User Password
Hive User Password
Hive User name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will connect to Hive with a username of "useraccount@email". The prompt will request a secure password.
If you need to pass the password value in the cmdlet directly, use the ConvertTo-SecureString function.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes Hive Session and clears the $Global:HiveHead variable

maml:Description.maml:para: {{Fill detailed Description}}
{{Fill detailed Description}}

dev:type.maml:name: Outputs the Hive Active Light properties Requires formatting
Outputs the Hive Active Plug properties Requires formatting

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves list of devices where the hive management app is installed
Retrieves hive contacts name and email

maml:Description.maml:para: If the Detailed Switch is used all device properties will be returned
If the Detailed Switch is used all device properties will be returned

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves hive events from all the hive devices

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the current hive temperature and reported time values

maml:description.maml:para: Returns topology for all hubs and devices associated with customer
Connects to British Gas Hive API and retrieves a token value for authentication

The Login-Hive function is used to connect to the Hive RESTful API and supply credentials to the /login method. Hive then returns a unique token to represent the user's credentials for subsequent calls. Acquire a token before running other Hive cmdlets.

maml:Description.maml:para: If the Detailed Switch is used all user properties will be returned
If the Detailed Switch is used all user properties will be returned

maml:description.maml:para: Provides basic temperature reading from the Hive Weather API
Uses a PostCode to retrieve current outside temperature. By default the users postcode is used in the query, this can be overridden using the PostCode parameter.

maml:Description.maml:para: UK Postcode
UK Postcode

dev:remarks.maml:para: Weather Icon : clear_sky Outside Weather : Clear Outside Temperature : 6.0 °C

maml:description.maml:para: Set properties on a specific Hive light.
Update specified Hive light with new desired state that can include a combination of: Brightness, Hue, PowerState, ColourMode and ColourTemperature

maml:Description.maml:para: ID of Hive Active Light Bulb
Desired Power state of the bulb
Desired colour mode of the bulb
Desired hue colour of the bulb
Desired brightness of the bulb
Desired colour temperature of the bulb
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Desired brightness of the bulb

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Turns on all hive active light bulbs

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get-HiveDevice | Where-Object name -Like " light " | Select-Object -ExpandProperty id | Set-HiveActiveLight -PowerState ON

maml:description.maml:para: Sets Power state on Active plug
Sets the power state on the Activeplug supplied to the ActivePlugID parameter

maml:Description.maml:para: The uniqe ID of the Active Plug to change the power state on, allows multiple id's to be supplied
The desired power state
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.dev:code: Turns off hive active lightbulb of supplied id

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Turns off all hive active lightbulbs

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get-HiveDevice | Where-Object name -Like SmartPlug* | Select-Object -ExpandProperty id | Set-HiveActivePlug -PowerState OFF

maml:description.maml:para: Sends Boost signal to Hive Heating System
Sends Boost signal to Hive Heating System with supplied parameters

maml:Description.maml:para: The Uniqe ID of the Receiver to change the temperature on
The New Temperature in Celcius EG. for 22°C -Temperature 22
The Desired Boost time in minutes in intervals of 30
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The Uniqe ID of the Receiver to change the temperature on
The New Temperature in Celcius EG. for 22°C -Temperature 22
The Desired Boost time in minutes in intervals of 30
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: (Get-HiveDevice | Where-Object name -Like rec*)[0] | Select-Object -ExpandProperty id | Set-HiveBoost -Time 120 -Temperature 22
